DOC.brief_summary: entGlycemic control has been found to improve clinical outcomes following Coronary Bypass Surgery. This study tests the hypothesis that obtaining tighter glycemic control(80-120mg/dl) as opposed to more moderate control (120-180mg/dl) will further improve outcomes.
DOC.brief_title: Aggressive Versus Moderate Glycemic Control in Diabetic Coronary Bypass Patients
DOC.detailed_description: 150 diabetic patients will be randomized to achieve aggressive glycemic control (80-120mg/dl) vs moderate control (120-180mg/dl) using intravenous insulin infusions beginning at anesthetic induction and continuing for 18 hours following surgery.
DOC.criteria: All diabetic patients undergoing Coronary Bypass Surgery Patients with hepatic and renal failure
